tn.text: Yahweh continues to tell Moses of his anger.

tn.ref: that land, which is flowing with milk and honey
tn.text: The land was good for raising livestock and growing crops. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:03:07|3:8]]. AT: "a land that is excellent for raising livestock and growing crops" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"full of" or "with an abundance of"
Since milk comes from cows and goats, this represents food produced by livestock. AT: "food from livestock" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Since honey is produced from flowers, this represents food from crops. AT: "food from crops" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"people who refuse to change"
beautiful clothing as well as chains and rings with jewels in them
"people who refuse to change." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:33:01|33:3]].
The cloud had the shape of a pillar. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:13:19|13:22]]. AT: "the cloud shaped like a pillar" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Where it came down from can be stated clearly. AT: "would come down from the sky" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: Yahweh would speak to Moses face to face
tn.text: Speaking directly rather than through dreams and visions, is spoken of as if Moses and God saw each other's faces while they spoke. AT: "Yahweh would speak directly to Moses" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
old enough to be a soldier ([[:en:bible:notes:exo:17:08|17:9-10]]), but much younger than Moses
"Look!" or "Listen!" or "Pay attention to what I am about to tell you."
To know someone by name is to know them well. AT: "I know you well" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: you have also found favor in my sight
tn.text: This is part of what God had told Moses. AT: "I am pleased with you" or "I approve of you"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: Now if I have found favor in your sight
tn.text: This is part of what Moses was saying to God. AT: "Now If  you are pleased with me" or "Now if you approve of me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Possible meanings: 1) "show me what you are going to do in the future" or 2) "show me how people can do what pleases you."
God's presence represents himself. AT: "I will go" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
The word "you" here refers to Moses. It is singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
"I will let you rest"
"For if your presence does not go with us"
This can be expressed with an active form. AT: how will people know" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: how will it be known ... people?
tn.text: Moses used this question in order to emphasize that if God does not go with them, no one will know that Moses had found favor in God's sight.  AT: "no one will know ... people." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: Will it not only be if
tn.text: "Will it not only be known if"
When Yahweh uses the word "you" in this verse, it is singular and refers to Moses. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: you have found favor in my sight
tn.text: This is an idiom that means that God is pleased with him. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:33:12|33:12]]. AT: "I am pleased with you" or "I approve of you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
To know someone by name is to know them well. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:33:12|33:12]]. AT: "I know you well" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: I will make all my goodness pass before you
tn.text: God speaks of walking past Moses so that Moses can see his goodness as if only his goodness would go past Moses. AT: "I will move past you so that you may see my goodness" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"Look" or "Listen" or "Pay attention to what I am about to tell you."
This is because Yahweh will be walking away from Moses.

tn.ref: but my face will not be seen
tn.text: This can be expressed in active form. AT: "but you will not see my face" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
